feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 2:17PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...POTENTIAL MARINE LAYER FOLLOWED BY WARMER THAN NORMAL TEMPERATURES HEADING INTO NEXT WEEK... Warmer than normal temperatures are expected by late this weekend as temperatures rise by a couple degrees each day. The warmest days are expected to be early next week with highs in the mid 70s and continued dry conditions.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 2:17PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...SIGNIFICANTLY WARMER THAN NORMAL TEMPERATURES HEADING INTO NEXT WEEK... Widespread significantly warmer than normal temperatures are expected by late this weekend as temperatures rise by a couple degrees each day. The warmest days are expected to be early next week with highs in the upper 80s and continued dry conditions.

entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Choctaw and northeastern Wayne Counties through 900 PM CDT... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 9:16PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Alleghany County in west central Virginia and Greenbrier Counties in southeastern West Virginia through 945 PM EDT... At 915 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Frankford, or near Renick, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph.

entry.title: Local Area Emergency issued June 22 at 9:16PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: The following message is transmitted at the request of the West Virginia EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY Charleston West Virginia. Metro 911 is receiving several reports of power lines down and trees down due to high wind. Avoid travel if you can and treat downed power lines as if they are live. Use caution!
